content:
0, 2016
												This game is about 2% of the quality of Fifa/PES titles. It's also 2% of the price. Have at it.LocoSoccer is a hilariously low-quality physics game. The enjoyment of it is in its simplicity and the stupidity that happens on most plays. For a buck, you can't go wrong but if you're really careful with your money and feel a dollar isn't worth the risk, look up the browser-based game Soccer Physics and give that a go as it's a much shorter version of the same concept. Where that is a 1-minute game, LocoSoccer ups the ante with a full on 5 minutes of gameplay per match with a team of 5. Contrary to some of the other reviews, you can switch players if you happen to read the controls (which are really like 4 buttons. I literally play this one handed).

er 9, 2015
												Lowcoball, while mostly bugless, features comically low production quality and, as other reviews have said, a mostly random playtime environment. I think that if it came out 20 years ago it would be an arcadey cult classic, but in this stage of video game development it's not there at all. If you want to buy a derpy game for your child to play while you go do something, or if you want a funny game to show your friends, go for it. But it's not worth any more than its price tag.

number of helpful: 10 of 11 people (91%) found this review helpful
content:
r 16, 2016
												 Endlessly, Dubiously scanning the "Under 2 dollars" games list with the pitiful toppence in my steam wallt when I spy this game.. The store page didn't look like much, But the reviews mostly pointed to a hilarious experience so I take a chance and buy this game.. Upon getting past the settings interface doubtingly setting the graphics to 'fantastic' in a tongue-in-cheek sort of manner I play my first round.. Couldn't figure out how to move my guys and noticed the AI bots cheat on easy (Using SHIFT to spin around). Finally learn to move ONE set of guys, Lost 7-0. Second match, Managed to figure out how to switch to my other team of guys using the number keys.. Figure out how to use SHIFT correctly, Win 9-4. Third round after buying some novelty stuff with my pitiful winnings, Found out I can get all four of my guys AND the goaler to shove the entire opposing team, AND their ball down the field. After a furious struggle of tug-of-war we pushed everyone AND the ball in the goal and won 8-3. Prognosis: Best one dollar I ever spent. My only complaints are the backround sound loops badly (Needs to be cut seamless) and has random disjointed voices of people talking. Likely recorded, And the lack of some method of making your own parts shirts or heads, And no online multiplayer. Despite the few flaws though and an 'unpolished' feel that some more serious gamers might avoid this is hilarious fun, Especially if you take the time to set up keyboard/joypad or joypad/joypad local play.9/10. Looking forward to the PS4 mega HD director's cut limited edition preorder collectible metal tin-and-biscuit remake.

number of helpful: 7 of 8 people (88%) found this review helpful
content:
er 21, 2016
												Almost every time reviewing a Unity engine game I have to say it's interface feels clunky & unresponsive, in this one they made that irritating quality a stepping stone of their gameplay - the whole process of 'soccer' is chaotic beyond measure, yet the AI is always more aware of the possible ball's trajectories than you could ever be. This is meant to achieve comedy effect, it succeeds for the first minutes... I mean, how fun a broken keyboard is? And if you hit it against your own head? It certainly may be quite fun if you play before a (heavily drunk) audience though.It's a 2d game with crude 3d graphics, where you get 'to control' (irony) 5 blocks colored as soccer players (2 pairs and a goalie), you switch between them with 1-2-3 numerical keys, these blocks can move from side to side, jump up and jump sidewards rotating in the air. Pairs can part at your command, but in reality they just part on collisions & jumps, then you have hard time getting them where you want (like it wasn't so before). Most goals are totally unexpected, sometimes ball just stalls under a pile of blocks for half a match, both players being unable to move further (more like a rugby game). Other times ball gets airborn and jumps its relentless sine path ignoring physical laws in a random direction. AI goalie sometimes saves, player's almost helpless if unlucky.Probably this makes an allright local party game, but can also lead to madness in a loser & rage attacks when unlucky, for it often feels really unfair - strange hitbox detection, unpredictable lunar physics, sometimes what should move stands still and vice versa. Take with caution! I recommend only because of its low price & stupid fun.

This whole game is just luck, but god damn, is it fun!10/10 would make a video about it.

content:
ry 27
												Upon buying this game, I felt immediately hooked to the campaign. It caused cliffhangers, action packed animation and it even caused me from my doing any of my university work, stopping me from going to the toilet, avoiding huge meal times to ensure I can get efficient time on the game and even blocking myself away from family and friends. LocoSoccer is life-changingly good. Unfortunately the developer couldn't offer me a soundtrack or a CD with the music theme which was a massive shame as the three second loop was absolutely FIRRRREEEE!!!!!!!.WARNING! DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE A SOCIAL LIFE AS THIS GAME WILL IMMEDIATELY TAKE IT AWAY FROM YOUThe graphics were impressive, the gameplay was outstounding and the card collecting was fun, it was like going to your nearest store and buying the pack hoping you earn that one card you needI give LocoSoccer a solid 11.74/10 and here's its good and bad points+ Outstanding graphics and gameplay+ It is only ♥♥♥♥ing 35p, the same price as a ♥♥♥♥ing energy drink+ The music is on the same level as Moonbahton- NO ♥♥♥♥ING NEGATIVES...THE GAME IS SICK!!
